name: Trigonometry
description:
Here's a basic example of how trigonometry can be used to solve a problem:
Suppose you have a right triangle with one angle measuring 30 degrees and one side measuring 8 units. You want to find the length of the other two sides.
By using the trigonometric functions, you can find the ratios of the sides of the triangle with respect to the angles. For this particular triangle, the sine of 30 degrees is 0.5, the cosine of 30 degrees is √3/2, and the tangent of 30 degrees is √3/3.
Using the sine function, you can find the length of the side opposite the 30-degree angle:
sin(30) = opposite side / 8
0.5 = opposite side / 8
opposite side = 4
Using the cosine function, you can find the length of the side adjacent to the 30-degree angle:
cos(30) = adjacent side / 8
√3/2 = adjacent side / 8
adjacent side = 4√3/2
So, in this example, the two sides of the triangle are 4 units and 4√3/2 units.

name: Fluida
description: Fluid is any liquid or gas or any material that is unable to withstand a shearing or tangential force, when at rest.

name: Acid
description: An acid is a proton donor. While a base is a proton acceptor. Acetic acid (CH3COOH) and sulphuric acid are two examples of Acid. Sodium Hydroxide (NaOH) and Ammonia are two examples of Bases.
